newsitem.title: USA: Perkin-Elmer takes stake in Hyseq.
newsitem.headline: Perkin-Elmer takes stake in Hyseq.

text.p: Perkin-Elmer Corp and Hyseq Inc said they are in a strategic partnership in which Perkin-Elmer will take an equity interest in Hyseq, investing $10 million in Hyseq and owning more than five percent of the company.
Both companies also will invest additional research funds in Hyseq's proprietary DNA HyChip technology as part of the five-year pact.
Hyseq has developed a DNA chip based on proprietary technology that allows diverse experiments to be conducted using a single-chip design.
Under the terms of the agreement, Perkin-Elmer will receive exclusive worldwide rights to commercialize sequencing systems using Hyseq's HyChip technology.
The companies aim to make available a "universal" chip that can assay any genetic target through the use of specially designed reagents and software, they said in a press release.
Perkin-Elmer makes life science systems and analytical instruments for pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, environmental testing, food, agriculture, and chemical manufacturing.
